Container.Name: cross-seed
Container.Overview:
Fully-automatic cross-seeding with Torznab
Configuration Templates can be found here: https://github.com/cross-seed/cross-seed/blob/master/src/config.template.docker.cjs
GitHub: https://github.com/cross-seed/cross-seed
Documentation/Support: https://cross-seed.org
Containers: https://github.com/cross-seed/cross-seed/pkgs/container/cross-seed

Config.Name: configDir
Config.Description:
This is your configuration/logs/cache directory.
Find the latest configuration template at the link below.
Rename to config.js and place in this directory before running. https://github.com/cross-seed/cross-seed/blob/master/src/config.template.docker.cjs

Config.Name: torrentDir
Config.Description:
Point this at a directory containing torrent files. If you don't know where your torrent client stores its files, the link below might help.
https://www.cross-seed.org/docs/basics/options#torrentdir

Config.Name: outputDir
Config.Description:
If you use the save action, this will be where cross-seed stores matched torrent files.
https://www.cross-seed.org/docs/basics/options#outputdir

Config.Name: port
Config.Description:
Enabled for daemon mode.
Choose a port. Make sure your container port matches in the config file

Config.Name: dataDir
Config.Description:
This is an optional path. If you are using data-based matching you will need to mount your torrent clients downloaded data. If injecting, the container paths should match your clients.
https://www.cross-seed.org/docs/tutorials/data-based-matching
